#summary How to setup the local development server

= Introduction =

In order to properly setup the local development server, do the following steps:


= Pass 1: Install the Application =

  # Download and install the Google App Engine Python runtime
  # Download the Pappa-Mi source here: http://pappa-mi.googlecode.com/files/pappami-2.0.0.0.rar and expand the archive in a directory called "pappami"
  # Run the App Engine Launcher and add the Pappa-Mi application selecting the previuosly created dir.
  # Run the application

= Pass 2: Upload configuration data =
  # Download the configuration data here: http://pappa-mi.googlecode.com/files/cfg.rar and expand it in a dir NOT under the previously created pappami dir
  # Run a command prompt and run the following command: set PYTHONPATH=<path to pappami dir>
  # Run the following commands:
    # appcfg.py upload_data --num_threads=1 --url=http://localhost:8080/_ah/remote_api --filename=<cfg dir>/cy.dat
    # appcfg.py upload_data --num_threads=1 --url=http://localhost:8080/_ah/remote_api --filename=<cfg dir>/cc.dat
    # appcfg.py upload_data --num_threads=1 --url=http://localhost:8080/_ah/remote_api --filename=<cfg dir>/cm.dat
    # appcfg.py upload_data --num_threads=1 --url=http://localhost:8080/_ah/remote_api --filename=<cfg dir>/ccc.dat
    # appcfg.py upload_data --num_threads=1 --url=http://localhost:8080/_ah/remote_api --filename=<cfg dir>/zo.dat
    # appcfg.py upload_data --num_threads=1 --url=http://localhost:8080/_ah/remote_api --filename=<cfg dir>/ccz.dat
    # appcfg.py upload_data --num_threads=1 --url=http://localhost:8080/_ah/remote_api --filename=<cfg dir>/mn.dat
    # appcfg.py upload_data --num_threads=1 --url=http://localhost:8080/_ah/remote_api --filename=<cfg dir>/pt.dat
    # appcfg.py upload_data --num_threads=1 --url=http://localhost:8080/_ah/remote_api --filename=<cfg dir>/pg.dat
  # The application is configured
